Description: CloudWatch Dashboards to investigate performance issues, throttling and charges related to CloudWatch Metrics and Alarms API calls. Both dashboards leverage Dashboard Variables to render metrics for the target region.

DefaultRegion.Description: Select the default region hosting the load balancers to be monitored.

properties.markdown:
## Alarms API Calls


This dashboard can assist with investigating performance issues or throttling on **CloudWatch Alarms API** calls. In the event you are observing throttling due to bursty calls, please ensure you are following AWS best practices to avoid API throttling:


- distribute API calls more evenly over time
- incorporate [Exponential Backoff and Jitter](https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/architecture/exponential-backoff-and-jitter/) to randomize when API calls are issued
- [employ Automatic Retries for failed API calls](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sdkref/latest/guide/feature-retry-behavior.html)


For **Infrastructure as Code (IaC)** deployments, CloudFormation will automatically retried failed API calls. If you are encountering throttling on **DescribeAlarms** or **PutMetricAlarm**, considering using [DependsOn attribute](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/aws-attribute-dependson.html) to distribute API calls over time.


[button:Prevent "Rate exceeded" errors in CloudFormation](https://repost.aws/knowledge-center/cloudformation-rate-exceeded-error)

properties.query:
SOURCE 'rtaa-s3-api-calls' | --Summarize DescribeAlarms calls by  IAM Role/User
SELECT `userIdentity.arn` as IAM_Role_User, count(*) AS CallCount
FROM `rtaa-s3-api-calls`
WHERE eventName = 'DescribeAlarms'
GROUP BY `userIdentity.arn`
ORDER BY CallCount DESC;
properties.title: DescribeAlarms: Calling IAM Role

properties.query:
SOURCE 'rtaa-s3-api-calls' | --Summarize DescribeAlarms calls by UserAgent, Client IP Address
SELECT `userAgent`, `sourceIPAddress` as ClientIP, count(*) AS CallCount
FROM `rtaa-s3-api-calls`
WHERE eventName = 'DescribeAlarms'
GROUP BY `userAgent`, `sourceIPAddress`
ORDER BY CallCount DESC
LIMIT 5;
properties.title: DescribeAlarms: UserAgent & Client IP Address

properties.markdown:
# Log Queries

`DescribeAlarms` and `PutMetricAlarms` are logged to CloudTrail. Consequently, CloudTrail is a good data source for obtaining more context on throttled or failed API calls. You can interrogate the CloudTrail console directly to investigate events within the last 90 days. 

If a CloudTrail trail has been created, it may be possible to query events written to S3 or CloudWatch Logs beyond 90 days. 

Below are sample Log Insight queries for reference, please update with the CloudWatch log group where CloudTrail events are being written.

properties.query:
SOURCE 'rtaa-s3-api-calls' | --Summarize PutMetricAlarm calls by  IAM Role/User
SELECT `userIdentity.arn` as IAM_Role_User, count(*) AS CallCount
FROM `rtaa-s3-api-calls`
WHERE eventName = 'PutMetricAlarm'
GROUP BY `userIdentity.arn`
ORDER BY CallCount DESC;
properties.title: PutMetricAlarm: Calling IAM Role

properties.query:
SOURCE 'rtaa-s3-api-calls' | --Summarize PutMetricAlarm calls by UserAgent, Client IP Address
SELECT `userAgent`, `sourceIPAddress` as ClientIP, count(*) AS CallCount
FROM `rtaa-s3-api-calls`
WHERE eventName = 'PutMetricAlarm'
GROUP BY `userAgent`, `sourceIPAddress`
ORDER BY CallCount DESC
LIMIT 5;
properties.title: PutMetricAlarms: UserAgent & Client IP Address

properties.markdown:
# Metrics APIs


This dashboard can assist with investigating performance issues, throttling and increased costs associated with **CloudWatch Metrics API** calls. In the event you are observing throttling due to bursty calls, please ensure you are following AWS best practices to avoid API throttling:


- distribute API calls more evenly over time
- incorporate [Exponential Backoff and Jitter](https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/architecture/exponential-backoff-and-jitter/) to randomize when API calls are issued
- [employ Automatic Retries for failed API calls](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sdkref/latest/guide/feature-retry-behavior.html)


In the event you are publishing a large number of custom metrics, you can consider [pre-aggregating metric data](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/cloudwatch_concepts.html#CloudWatchAggregation) with [StatisticSet](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/APIReference/API_StatisticSet.html).


[button: Avoid throttling with PutMetricData](https://repost.aws/knowledge-center/cloudformation-rate-exceeded-error)


 [CloudWatch Billing
documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/cloudwatch_billing.html) provides guidance on analyzing CloudWatch charges as well as best practices to avoid excessive charges.


[GetMetricData](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/APIReference/API_GetMetricData.html
 API calls are not captured in CloudTrail by default. CloudTrail data events
attract additional charges and must be [explicitly enabled to log GetMetricData API calls](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/logging_cw_api_calls.html#CloudWatch-data-plane-events). These CloudTrail events can provide more detail on the clients responsible for increased API call volume:
- Account ID
- IAM Role
- Source IP Address


AWS Blog article [Identifying resources driving Amazon CloudWatch GetMetricData charges using AWS CloudTrail](https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/mt/identifying-resources-driving-amazon-cloudwatch-getmetricdata-charges-using-aws-cloudtrail/) walks you through how to perform this analysis.


CloudTrail log events can be written to S3 or CloudWatch Logs.

properties.query:
SOURCE 'rtaa-s3-api-calls' | --Summarize GetMetricData calls by Account ID
SELECT `userIdentity.accountId` as Account_ID, count(*) AS CallCount
FROM `rtaa-s3-api-calls`
WHERE eventName = 'GetMetricData'
GROUP BY `userIdentity.accountId`
ORDER BY CallCount DESC;
properties.title: Summarize GetMetricData calls by AWS Account ID

properties.query:
SOURCE 'rtaa-s3-api-calls' | --Summarize GetMetricData calls by  IAM Role/User
SELECT `userIdentity.arn` as IAM_Role_User, count(*) AS CallCount
FROM `rtaa-s3-api-calls`
WHERE eventName = 'GetMetricData'
GROUP BY `userIdentity.arn`
ORDER BY CallCount DESC;
properties.title: Summarize GetMetricData calls by IAM Role/User

properties.query:
SOURCE 'rtaa-s3-api-calls' | --Summarize GetMetricData calls by UserAgent, Client IP Address
SELECT `userAgent`, `sourceIPAddress` as ClientIP, count(*) AS CallCount
FROM `rtaa-s3-api-calls`
WHERE eventName = 'GetMetricData'
GROUP BY `userAgent`, `sourceIPAddress`
ORDER BY CallCount DESC
LIMIT 5;
properties.title: Summarize GetMetricData calls by UserAgent, Client IP Address

properties.query:
SOURCE 'rtaa-s3-api-calls' | --Summarize PutMetricData calls by Account ID
SELECT `userIdentity.accountId` as Account_ID, count(*) AS CallCount
FROM `rtaa-s3-api-calls`
WHERE eventName = 'PutMetricData'
GROUP BY `userIdentity.accountId`
ORDER BY CallCount DESC;
properties.title: Summarize PutMetricData calls by Account ID

properties.query:
SOURCE 'rtaa-s3-api-calls' | --Summarize PutMetricData calls by  IAM Role/User
SELECT `userIdentity.arn` as IAM_Role_User, count(*) AS CallCount
FROM `rtaa-s3-api-calls`
WHERE eventName = 'PutMetricData'
GROUP BY `userIdentity.arn`
ORDER BY CallCount DESC;
properties.title: Summarize PutMetricData calls by  IAM Role/User

properties.query:
SOURCE 'rtaa-s3-api-calls' | --Summarize PutMetricData calls by UserAgent, Client IP Address
SELECT `userAgent`, `sourceIPAddress` as ClientIP, count(*) AS CallCount
FROM `rtaa-s3-api-calls`
WHERE eventName = 'PutMetricData'
GROUP BY `userAgent`, `sourceIPAddress`
ORDER BY CallCount DESC
LIMIT 5;
properties.title: Summarize PutMetricData calls by UserAgent, Client IP Address

properties.query:
SOURCE 'rtaa-s3-api-calls' | #PutMetricData: Entity, ResourceType, Client IP, Namespace, CallCount
filter eventName = 'PutMetricData' 
| stats count(*) as CallCount by requestParameters.entityMetricData.0.entity.keyAttributes.Identifier as Entity, requestParameters.entityMetricData.0.entity.keyAttributes.ResourceType as ResourceType, sourceIPAddress as Client_IP, requestParameters.namespace as Namespace
| sort CallCount desc
properties.title: PutMetricData: Entity, ResourceType, Client IP & Namespace

properties.query:
SOURCE 'rtaa-s3-api-calls' | #PutMetricData: Calling Account ID, Client IP Address, Namespace
filter eventName = 'PutMetricData' 
| stats count(*) as CallCount by userIdentity.accountId as Calling_Account_ID, sourceIPAddress as Client_IP, requestParameters.namespace as Namespace
| sort CallCount desc
properties.title: PutMetricData: Calling Account ID, Client IP Address & Namespace
